DOC.brief_title: Treatment of Portal Vein Tumor Thrombus After Hepatocellular Carcinoma Resection
DOC.detailed_description: Hepatectomy is still the treatment of choice for hepatocellular carcinoma, but the prognosis is not agreeable. Part of the patients may present portal vein tumor thrombus (PVTT) after resection. PVTT might further increase the pressure of portal vein and lead to upper gastrointestinal bleeding and worsening of hypersplenism which will endanger the life of the patients. PVTT also plays the centre role of recurrence and metastasis of HCC. There is no standard treatment available now for PVTT yet. TACE is mostly often used to treat the PVTT. We aim to compare the effects of TACE and TACE plus laser ablation for treating patients with PVTT.
DOC.criteria: 1. PVTT after liver resection was diagnosed with at least two types of imaging findings, such as CT, MRI or color doplor findings. 2. The functions of the kidney, heart and lung and the routine test of the blood are in good condition. 3. The liver function is of grade A or B in ChildPugh classification. 4. The patient is eligible of the trial and will show consent to the test. 1. any of the parameters. WBC less than 2000/ml, Hb less than 90g/L or PLT less than 50000/ml. 2. disfunction of the heart, lung, kidney, or brain. 3. any other disease might affect the trial . 4. the patients would not sign the consent to the trial.
